## Example package.json scripts for concurrently

```jsonc
{
  // ...
  "scripts": {
    "lint:js": "...",
    "lint:ts": "...",
    "lint:fix:js": "...",
    "lint:fix:ts": "..."
    // ...
  }
  // ...
}
```

## Running Tests with pnpm - Bash

```bash
pnpm test
```

## Running a single script shortcut with concurrently (pnpm)

```bash
$ concurrently 'pnpm:lint:js'
# Is equivalent to
$ concurrently -n lint:js 'pnpm run lint:js'
```

## Enabling Input Handling with --handle-input

```bash
$ concurrently --handle-input 'nodemon' 'npm run watch-js'
rs
```

## Targeting Input by Command Index

```bash
$ concurrently --handle-input 'npm run watch-js' 'nodemon'
1:rs
```

## Running wildcard shortcut with exclusion pattern (yarn)

```bash
$ concurrently 'yarn:lint:*(!fix)'
# is equivalent to
$ concurrently -n js,ts 'yarn run lint:js' 'yarn run lint:ts'
```

## Using concurrently with multiple commands in JavaScript

```JavaScript
const concurrently = require('concurrently');
const { result } = concurrently(
  [
    'npm:watch-*',
    { command: 'nodemon', name: 'server' },
    { command: 'deploy', name: 'deploy', env: { PUBLIC_KEY: '...' } },
    {
      command: 'watch',
      name: 'watch',
      cwd: path.resolve(__dirname, 'scripts/watchers'),
    },
  ],
  {
    prefix: 'name',
    killOthers: ['failure', 'success'],
    restartTries: 3,
    cwd: path.resolve(__dirname, 'scripts'),
  },
);
result.then(success, failure);
```

## Default Input Handling Behavior in concurrently

```bash
$ concurrently 'nodemon' 'npm run watch-js'
rs
```

## Targeting Input by Command Name

```bash
$ concurrently --handle-input --names js,server 'npm run watch-js' 'nodemon'
server:rs
```
